CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 15, 1958, pg. 2, reads: "Does This Condition Exist in Other Neighborhoods? Liquor Control Board Should Exercise Better Judgment - One of the overlooked evils in some neighborhoods of Allegheny County is the location of taverns in close proximity to churches, schools and playgrounds. Although such establishments do not operate on Sundays, their presence and the conduct of some patrons prove annoying during the week....  Mt. Zion Pentacostal [Pentecostal] Temple...two doors down from tavern on Webster Avenue."
TitMainTitle: Mount Zion Church Pentecostal Temple, with sign for minister Elder P. W. Washington, Webster Avenue, Hill District
